com.dev.yvgenijsharovskij.n5kanjiandkanjistoryquiz.database

Class DbAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dev.yvgenijsharovskij.n5kanjiandkanjistoryquiz.database.DbAccess

  • public class DbAccess
extends java.lang.Object
    DbAccess provides access to the db, with some read and write methods. This class is constructed as a singleton, whereby a single instance of DbAccess is handled throughout the entire application life-cycle via the BaseActivity class, thus making it thread-safe and avoiding the need for synchronization.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Yvgenij Sharovskij

      • getInstance

        public static DbAccess getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        If the instance already exists, then getInstance(Context) simply returns the instance. If the instance does not exist yet, then getInstance(Context) will call the constructor to create it.
        Uses lazy initialization, whereby the instance is created when the static method is first invoked.
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        Returns:
        instance of DbAccess

      • getTwoDbColumnsAsOneRandomArray

        public java.lang.Object[] getTwoDbColumnsAsOneRandomArray(java.lang.String db_column1,
                                                          java.lang.String db_column2,
                                                          java.lang.String db_table,
                                                          int db_limit)

      • getFourDbColumnsAsTwoRandomArrayLists

        public java.lang.Object[] getFourDbColumnsAsTwoRandomArrayLists(java.lang.String db_column1,
                                                                java.lang.String db_column2,
                                                                java.lang.String db_column3,
                                                                java.lang.String db_column4,
                                                                java.lang.String db_table,
                                                                int db_limit)
        Gets a raw SQL query from the database: get four table columns into two arrays, where the isIncluded column is '1' with the random order: ORDER BY RANDOM() LIMIT. The number of retrieved db columns varies between 2 and 4, depending on the QNA type selection, c.f. QNAManager.setDbDataToSettings(). The isIncluded table column is set to '1' by default, which can be changed by the user in the KanjiListFragment.
        Parameters:
        db_column1 - the db table column name
        db_column2 - the db table column name
        db_column3 - the db table column name
        db_column4 - the db table column name
        db_table - the db table name
        db_limit - the db LIMIT
        Returns:
        ArrayList of the selected rawQuery

      • doesColumnExistsInTable

        public boolean doesColumnExistsInTable(java.lang.String db_table,
                                       java.lang.String db_column)
        Checks if a column exists in the table by querying a row with getColumnIndex().
        Parameters:
        db_table - the db table name
        db_column - the db table column name
        Returns:
        true, if the column exists in the table

      • updateKanji

        public void updateKanji(java.util.LinkedList<Kanji> kanjiList,

        Updates the given Kanji in the SQL datebase using execSQL(), specifically the isIncluded column in the QNA table.
        Parameters:
        kanjiList - List of Kanji
        kanji - Kanji object to be updated
